what: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: chcRne package developed organize functions, useful code snippets, information relevant Research Evaluation team Center Healthy Communities.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section used used data management. pnta.unanswered..miss() Sets options (vars) select apply questions NA “Prefer answer” option selected.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section return statistics often used expalnations figures. Many functions often used inline code. count_and_percent() Returns string includes total count percentage categories input variable.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section used creation figures, tables, visualizations. nperc_tbl_MATA() Creates table showing n counts percentages option mark apply question. Link package description:

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
code: library(chcRne)  cols <- c("no_goingout_cooking", "no_goingout_broke") rnames <- c("I like cooking", "I am a broke college student")  # Create table that reports n count and percent for a mark all that apply question table1 <- nperc_tbl_MATA(df = exp.data,                vars = cols,                value = "1",                row.names = rnames,                punc = ".",                col.title = "Why not go out to eat?") table1 count_and_percent(var = exp.data$no_goingout_cooking, "1") ## [1] "11 (55.0%)"

Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: function creates table showing n counts percentages option mark apply question.

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: df data frame used create table. vars character vector variable names include table (vars binary). value value rows `vars` (one value across variables). row.names name row table. equivalent option select apply question punc punctuation end row names.

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: frequency table

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
code: # Save the variable names to questions and the names of the questions to rnames cols <- c("q14_1", "q14_3", "q14_4")  nperc_tbl_MATA(df = bns2_pkg_data,                vars = cols,                value = "Yes",                row.names = c("I am a broke college student","No good restaurants", "I like cooking"),                punc = ".") #>                                           Yes (%) #> I am a broke college student. (n = 48) 27 (56.2%) #> I like cooking. (n = 43)               21 (48.8%) #> No good restaurants. (n = 45)           5 (11.1%)

code: updated_data <- pnta.unanswered.to.miss(data = bns2_pkg_data,                                   prefix = "q14_2",                                   pnta = bns2_pkg_data$q14_30) updated_data |> dplyr::select(q14_20:q14_26, q14_30) #> # A tibble: 50 × 8 #>    q14_20 q14_21 q14_22 q14_23 q14_24 q14_25 q14_26 q14_30 #>     <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1     NA      0      0      0      0      0      0      0 #>  2     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      1 #>  3     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      1 #>  4     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA #>  5     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      0 #>  6     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      0 #>  7     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA #>  8     NA      0      0      0      0      0      0      0 #>  9     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      0 #> 10     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA     NA      1 #> # ℹ 40 more rows

what: Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
title: Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
text: function takes dataframe prefix identify specific columns names. converts "Yes"/"" responses columns binary numeric values, "" 0 "Yes" 1.

title: Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
text: data dataframe containing variables converted. prefix character string used select columns name. Columns whose names start prefix "Yes"/"" values converted 0/1.

title: Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
text: original dataframe specified Yes/variables converted binary numeric values.

title: Convert Yes/No Variables to Binary — yesno_to_binary
code: # Convert "Yes"/"No" responses in columns starting with "q14" to 0/1 df_converted <- yesno_to_binary(bns2_pkg_data, "q14_")  # View the converted dataframe side-by-side old <- bns2_pkg_data |> dplyr::select(q14_1, q14_4) new <- df_converted |> dplyr::select(q14_1, q14_4) cbind(old, new) #>    q14_1 q14_4 q14_1 q14_4 #> 1     No    No     0     0 #> 2    Yes    No     1     0 #> 3    Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 4    Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 5     No    No     0     0 #> 6     No    No     0     0 #> 7    Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 8    Yes    No     1     0 #> 9     No   Yes     0     1 #> 10   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 11    No   Yes     0     1 #> 12   Yes    No     1     0 #> 13    No   Yes     0     1 #> 14    No    No     0     0 #> 15    No    No     0     0 #> 16   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 17   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 18    No    No     0     0 #> 19    No    No     0     0 #> 20   Yes    No     1     0 #> 21   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 22   Yes  <NA>     1    NA #> 23  <NA>  <NA>    NA    NA #> 24    No  <NA>     0    NA #> 25   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 26    No  <NA>     0    NA #> 27    No    No     0     0 #> 28   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 29    No    No     0     0 #> 30   Yes    No     1     0 #> 31   Yes    No     1     0 #> 32   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 33   Yes    No     1     0 #> 34   Yes    No     1     0 #> 35    No    No     0     0 #> 36   Yes  <NA>     1    NA #> 37   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 38    No   Yes     0     1 #> 39    No   Yes     0     1 #> 40    No   Yes     0     1 #> 41   Yes    No     1     0 #> 42    No   Yes     0     1 #> 43    No    No     0     0 #> 44   Yes    No     1     0 #> 45   Yes    No     1     0 #> 46   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 47    No   Yes     0     1 #> 48   Yes   Yes     1     1 #> 49  <NA>  <NA>    NA    NA #> 50   Yes  <NA>     1    NA
